sub_title: Supporting businesses with their digital transformation
summary:
I am passionate about using all kinds of data science techniques to solve business issues and I have a particular interest in IoT. 

I have 12 years of experience in IT, with a strong focus on Data Science and Business Intelligence. During this period I have gained experience in various industries, such as the chemical and pharmaceutical industry, retail, nano technology, financial services, governmental and HR organizations. 

I have extensive experience in SQL and SAS and 5 years of experience in Python and 2 years experience in Spark. A detailed description of the projects I have worked on in the past, can be found in the projects section below. 

I have a Master of Science in Business Economics and an advanced Master of Science in Data Science for Business.

education.field_of_study: Business administration / Bedrijfskunde / Business management / Bedrijfsmanagement

projects.title: Air Quality Features Time Series Prediction at Business&Decision(research project)
projects.description:
•	Data exploration : 
Checking the distribution of the time series using descriptive statistics and plots
•	Data cleaning: 
which are the best techniques to impute missing values? 
Which are the best techniques to deal with outliers? 
Which transformations could be applied on the time series data and when are they necessary?
•	Feature engineering :
How can we, in an efficient way, detect seasonality and trend?
•	Which techniques can be used to model these kinds of time series data?
Simple Exponential Smoothing, Holt Winter’s Exponential Smoothing, (S)ARIMA(X),TBATS, Dynamic Linear Models, Garch, XGBoost, machine learning(batch & incremental learning) techniques, deep learning techniques, ...
•	Are other time series affecting the time series that I am analyzing? If yes, how to implement these covariates using the above used techniques?

contributors.headline: Supporting businesses with their digital transformation

projects.title: machine learning on returns of tax investigations at Ministry of Finance
projects.description: The current solution to manage the risk of non-submission of the declaration by companies is not entirely satisfactory. With the current approach it is not always possible to estimate a tax base, resulting in the inability to generate alerts and start an investigation. To improve the current approach for a specific population a predictive model has been build. This population consists of companies for which no alert has been generated, but whose case, treated by conventional investigation services, resulted in a return in excess of 19,000 euros. With the model we want to predict whether or not an investigation will result in a return in excess of 28,500 euros, which is the minimum amount for an investigation to be profitable.

contributors.headline: Supporting businesses with their digital transformation

projects.title: Opportunities Scoring
projects.description: OBS is a consultancy company and has already installed a nice procedure to handle opportunities. With this procedure they are able to win around 75% of the opportunities they consider as interesting. Nevertheless, they want to improve that win rate and detect/predict those opportunities which have the biggest chance of being won by creating models for several stages in the sales cycle. By identifying these opportunities, they will be able to focus more on the right opportunities.

contributors.headline: Supporting businesses with their digital transformation

projects.title: Senior Data Scientist at Delhaize
projects.description: Investigating the differences in the ABT’s of the old and new version of the brand segmentation. These ABT’s contained around 230 variables for which first had to be checked whether the variable significantly differed in content between the old and the new version and when this was the case, try to figure out what the root cause of the difference was. Recreating the product and basket offers post campaign analysis in gen2 environment. Segmenting the wine customers into Professional, Quality, Occasional, Regular and Wine Event Buyers, to be used as selection tool for wine events.

contributors.headline: Supporting businesses with their digital transformation

projects.title: Know Your Customer at Belfius
projects.description: The anti-money laundering law of 18 September 2017 requires banks to identify the client's characteristics and the purpose and intended nature of the business relationship. Belfius Bank must prepare a Know Your Customer (KYC) document for each of its customers. As part of the onboarding process, for most of its new clients Belfius agents fill in a KYC fiche. But also for the existing customers this questionnaire has to be filled out. As Belfius has more than 3000.000 clients, doing this manually would be cumbersome. For most of the existing customers, where possible, questionnaires will be prefilled by querying transaction data using Spark SQL and PySpark. Python is being used to perform statistical analysis and for data visualization purposes.

contributors.headline: Supporting businesses with their digital transformation

projects.title: Late Payment Prediction at Securex
projects.description: With this project Securex would like to gain more insight into the payment behaviour of its clients. This project covers all steps from data integration of source data into the SAS data warehouse, reporting on payment behaviour in Qlik Sense and data exploration, feature engineering, data cleaning, feature selection and machine learning using Python on a Microsoft Azure Data Science Virtual Machine. And last but not least, models which predict whether customers will have late payments of invoices in the future, were created.

contributors.headline: Supporting businesses with their digital transformation

projects.title: Churn Prediction at Securex
projects.description: Each year between January and July customers of SSS have to indicate to Securex that they have the intention of ending the contract by the end of the year. Securex wants to be more proactive in identifying possible leaving customers. They had the intention of creating a model, which predicts whether or not customers will be indicating in the first 6 months of the year that they want to end the contract by the end of the year. It turned out that they didn't have yet data with enough predictive power to create such a model.

contributors.headline: Supporting businesses with their digital transformation

projects.title: Client channel usage segmentation at Belfius
projects.description: Belfius wanted to have a better insight in the channel usage of its clients. They wanted to know what kind of segments of clients existed based on the channels they use for their interaction with the bank. Data about all the relevant types of interactions of the clients with the bank had to be gathered. Based on this data a clustering had to be performed to create distinct segments of clients. The segments were further analyzed and a profile for each of the client segments was created.

contributors.headline: Supporting businesses with their digital transformation

projects.title: macro economic study at Belfius
projects.description:
Belfius wants to be able to make statements about the Belgian economy faster than the NBB, and this based on in-house customer data. Belfius has a lot of data on revenues and expenses of customers and wants to analyze the savings and expenditure behavior of the Belgians. Based on various analysis groups (Belgium, region, age group, income group, quarterly, self employed vs. employee) Belfius would like to make statements about:
 - savings
 - shares of the various components of income in total  income
 - evolution of household income, household consumption  and household savings

contributors.headline: Supporting businesses with their digital transformation

projects.title: Survival Analysis at Ministry of Finance
projects.description: The department I&I creates every year a model which predicts whether or not a company will go bankrupt in the course of the following year. It would even be better if they would also know when exactly in the next year the company will go bankrupt, enabling the government to retrieve tax debs before the companies go bankrupt. The purpose of this research project was to investigate whether a survival model(Cox proportional hazard model) could be used to predict the time to bankruptcy of companies.

contributors.headline: Supporting businesses with their digital transformation

projects.title: flexible ETL architecture for analytical purposes at Ministry of Finance
projects.description:
The tax investigation targeting tool was created, maintained and run by the IT department. By consequence, the business didn't have any insight in the way it was being handled by IT and could not influence the way it should be handled. There was no way of altering the rules in a flexible way.
The purpose of this project was to set up a flexible ETL process flow(using SAS macros and excel files with meta data), which can be maintained, altered and run by the business.  The architecture should also enable dataminers to use the data preparation part of the ETL process flow to create analytical tables, which can be used for targeting or analytical purposes in other projects.

contributors.headline: Supporting businesses with their digital transformation

projects.title: machine learning on tax debt data at Ministry of Finance
projects.description: PEGASUS will support an accurate and strategic recovery policy. By creating models which predict whether or not companies are going to pay back their tax debts and models which predict how much companies are going to pay back to the Belgian government, the most interesting companies for targeting will be discovered.

projects.description: Development of a short and a long-term Data Quality and Data Governance approach. I was responsible for the short-term solution development of data quality checks.

projects.title: fraud detection using machine learning at Ministry of Finance
projects.description: Creating binary classification models for fraud detection on Risk Capital Deduction. With these models the government wanted to be able to detect with a minimum of work which companies used deduction rules of which they were not eligible to.

projects.title: BI for Offender Management at Ministry of Justice
projects.description: Business & Decision has developed a solution for Offender Management (Mi-Case). The solution is being deployed for the Ministry of Justice in Belgium. The solution is not equipped with an Analytics module. This research project aims at deploying BI and advanced analytics capabilities for Offender Management. In the first phase, it will address capacity management and recidivism. I was responsible for data discovery and exploration.

projects.title: Marketing Campaign Analysis at ING
projects.description: I was responsible for the analysis of marketing campaigns at ING. I analyzed both above the line and below the line campaigns. After analyzing the impact of a marketing campaign on sales and conversions and calculating the ROI of a campaign, I had to present the analysis results to marketing and sales responsibles.

contributors.headline: Supporting businesses with their digital transformation

projects.title: ABB Change Requests at UCB
projects.description: The Activity Based Budgeting tool is used for budget exercises at UCB. It is part of the closed loop cost management. The ABB tool enables each Cost Center/Project owner to budget on all cost categories. Existing jobs had to be changed, new jobs had to be added and new sources had to be incorporated.

contributors.headline: Supporting businesses with their digital transformation

projects.title: Sales Forecasting at UCB
projects.description: The aim of this project was to industrialize the forecasting process. For the markets Rheumatoid Arthritis, Crohn’s Disease, Epilepsy, Parkinson’s disease and Restless Legs Syndrome sales forecasts had to be provided with a hierarchy based on year, month, country and brand competitor. Both sales in volumes as sales in monetary value had to be forecasted. The implemented sales forecasts had to be integrated with other UCB forecasts and put into a cube that is used in excel to create pivot table reports.

contributors.headline: Supporting businesses with their digital transformation
Data Science Advisor

projects.title: Lead Time/Cycle Time Performance Dashboard at UCB
projects.description:
The goal of this project was to create a dashboard environment for senior management of the Supply Chain department of UCB. It had to present the key KPIs about Lead Time/Cycle time performance. 
SAS DI Studio was used to implement the data warehouse and data marts. Based on a SAP BW cube an ETL process flow was built, resulting in three data marts containing information about KPIs. The reports were built on these data marts. The WRS report contains three independent sections each providing a part of the report and is based on stored processes. Each section has its own level of granularity, allowing the business to adopt a top down approach in their analysis.

Accounting | Tax

projects.title: BI for Demand Planning at DuPont
projects.description: Du Pont is a chemical company specialised in paint solutions. The department “Demand Planning” struggled with their reporting environment and wanted to replace the Digital Tempus cubes by SAS solutions. An ETL process flow in SAS Enterprise Guide which results in SAS data sets and output files was developed. These output files were inputs for other systems. On top of one of the SAS data sets an OLAP cube, which could be consulted by the Demand Planning team through SAS MS Excel Add-In, was developed. On top of another SAS data set a stored process, that calculates forecast accuracy rates on an aggregation level specified by the user and taking into account filters specified by the user, was created.
